pkgmetadata.longdescription: Accessing Data Stored in 'LaBB-CAT' Instances // 'LaBB-CAT' is a web-based language corpus management system developed by the New Zealand Institute of Language, Brain and Behaviour (NZILBB) - see https://labbcat.canterbury.ac.nz. This package defines functions for accessing corpus data in a 'LaBB-CAT' instance. You must have at least version 20200108.1025 of 'LaBB-CAT' to use this package. For more information about 'LaBB-CAT', see Robert Fromont and Jennifer Hay (2008) doi:10.3366/E1749503208000142 or Robert Fromont (2017) doi:10.1016/j.csl.2017.01.004.
